description:
Yongam Falls is only really worth doing during the rainy season, but when there is plenty of water it is quite spectacular.

Approach

Take the trail approaching Yongambong and Mansubong After 30 minutes of hiking from the parking, you are probably close to having gained enough elevation. Detour away from the trail (head left). You should be able to find a dry gully which enters the main stream.

Descent

The main falls are descended in two stages. Check that the top part of the fall is not filled with logs in the choke point - otherwise retrieval is problematic. Anchors for the final part are poor. One sling and maillon left in-situ.

No other bolts or anchors. Use trees.


R30, R15, R6, R8, R9, R6

(After the the stream passes under the road, there is a slide at high water levels. This should be entered separately. There is a trail from the main parking area)

Exit

Exit discreetly - it is close to a ranger station.

Red tape

Like all canyons in Korea - assume that you're not supposed to be there.

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Yongam Falls, Woraksan
